ygData.subject: Re: Archery training
ygData.msgSnippet: Hail, I dropped in 5 points and have been using a fine player made bow. I have gone through 60 arrrows, on all reds, whites, and blues (oh how american) and
ygData.messageBody:
Hail,

I dropped in 5 points and have been using a fine player made bow. I
have gone through 60 arrrows, on all reds, whites, and blues (oh how
american) and have yet to see any improvement.

-Dycedarg
DragonFire Guild

> -----Original Message-----
> From: McConnell, Jeff [SMTP:Jeff.McConnell@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 2:47 PM
> To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
> Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] Archery training
>
> From: "McConnell, Jeff" <Jeff.McConnell@...>
>
> Hail
> I have a cheap hunting bow as well and I put one point into it and burned
> about 30 arrows and seen mine raise to 14.
>
> Silvermyst
> 13th
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Gary Long [SMTP:glong@...]
> > Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 2:30 PM
> > To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
> > Subject: [eqpaladin] Archery training
> >
> > From: Gary Long <glong@...>
> >
> > Hail fellow Paladins,
> >
> > I was wondering how all of you were faring with archery skill
> advancement?
> > At
> > 10th level, sinking 1 training point into archery, then using 20 arrows
> > with a
> > cheap hunting bow I have yet to see my skill increase. I purchased a
> tiny
> > dagger from a friendly enchanter, but found that I can't equip it. My
> > next
> > thought is to either purchase a lot of arrows (100) and use the bow as
> > much as
> > possible or to "jump start" the archery skill by putting 5 more training
> > points
> > into it. Any feedback or opinions?
> >
> > Kaladin, the 'range 50' Paladin
